http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS List ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-25T10:01:49Z Jane Ronson 2015-02-25T10:01:30+00:00 2015-02-25T10:01:30+00:00 Archives Hub News - February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;a4b7949a.1502 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature**<br><br>This month the Shakespeare Institute Library write about their monthly exhibitions which bring out lesser known aspects of their collections and especially their archive holdings.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2015/02/exhibitions-at-the-shakespeare-institute-seeing-beyond-the-book-shelves/<br><br>**Just a few of the latest descriptions added to the Hub:**<br><br>* Hunters and Company, Bankers, Ayr, 1657-1854. Hunters and Company of Ayr was established in October 1773. The most prominent partner was James Hunter (1727-1776) who belonged to one of the burgh's foremost merchant families.<br>Held by Lloyds Banking Group Archives (Edinburgh):<br>http://archiveshub.ac.uk/data/gb1830-hun [...] Jane Ronson 2015-01-29T13:20:33+00:00 2015-01-29T13:20:33+00:00 Archives Hub News - January 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;c9efe6af.1501 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature**<br><br>This month we've produced a showcase of all our features from 2014, with themes including banking, dance, war, peace and educational reform.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2015/01/2014-features-showcase/<br><br>**Just a few of the latest descriptions added to the Hub:**<br><br>* Baker Brown Archive, c. 20th century. Correspondence, photographs, maps and memorabilia relating to World War I.<br>Held at Newcastle University: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/data/gb186-tbb [...] Jane Ronson 2014-12-19T12:33:49+00:00 2014-12-19T12:33:49+00:00 Archives Hub News - December 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;15750f55.1412 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature - December**<br><br>This month our feature is (loosely!) based on the traditional folk melody 'The Twelve Days of Christmas'. Collections highlighted include those of the drummer Max Abrams, the Swan Land and Cattle Company, Hen Gapel, Llanbryn-mair Chapel Records (one of the oldest and most famous chapels in Wales) and the singer David Cassidy. [...] Jane Ronson 2014-11-27T15:11:17+00:00 2014-11-27T15:11:17+00:00 Archives Hub News - November 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;dc66bb0c.1411 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature - November**<br><br>This month we look at James Phillips Kay-Shuttleworth, whose papers have recently been catalogued by archivists at The University of Manchester Library: his career, family ties and literary circles.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2014/11/james-phillips-kay-shuttleworth-pioneering-educational-reformer/<br><br>**New contributors to the Hub include:**<br><br>* Aberdeenshire Museums Service - http://archiveshub.ac.uk/contributors/aberdeenshiremuseums.html<br><br>* University of Portsmouth - http://archiveshub.ac.uk/contributors/universityofportsmouth.html [...] Jane Ronson 2014-10-31T09:14:42+00:00 2014-10-31T09:14:42+00:00 Archives Hub News - September/October 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;ea8dc29f.1410 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature - October**<br><br>This month we look at the Institution of Mechanical Engineers' archives: how the war sparked a technological battle for the best weapons, infrastructure and defences, and what this meant for engineering and women workers.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2014/10/engineering-and-innovation-during-the-first-world-war/<br><br>**Hub monthly feature - September**<br><br>Our September feature is all about Kettle's Yard Archive, University of Cambridge. Originally the home of Jim Ede, it is much more than a house, a museum or a gallery. [...] Jane Ronson 2014-08-27T14:50:18+00:00 2014-08-27T14:50:18+00:00 Archives Hub News - August 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;fe1f3f0d.1408 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature**<br><br>This month we look at the Swords into Ploughshares project, encompassing the cataloguing of two peace<br>organisations archives at London School of Economics: the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom (WILPF)and the Fellowship of Reconciliation: London Union (FOR), both formed during World War One.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2014/08/swords-into-ploughshares/ . [...] Jane Ronson 2014-08-01T09:27:17+00:00 2014-08-01T09:27:17+00:00 Hub team office move https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;c38f5714.1408 Dear all<br><br>As mentioned recently, we are moving offices! Telephone numbers remain the same but contact may unavailable Friday/Monday. Email should be unaffected and we'll reply as soon as we can.<br>Our new address is:<br><br>Archives Hub<br>J Floor, Sackville Street Building<br>Sackville Street<br>Manchester<br>M1 3BB<br><br>Thanks for bearing with us!<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Jane<br><br>Jane Ronson<br>Development and Outreach Officer<br>Archives Hub [...] Jane Ronson 2014-07-31T12:13:56+00:00 2014-07-31T12:13:56+00:00 Archives Hub News - July 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;14c423f9.1407 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature**<br><br>This month we look at the Anti-Apartheid Movement, focusing on archives held at the Bodleian Library, University of Oxford, together with a number of other apartheid-related collections on the Archives Hub.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2014/07/the-anti-apartheid-movement/<br><br>**Just a few of the descriptions added to the Hub during July:**<br><br>* Papers of the Drury-Lowe family of Locko Park, c.1180-1992 - The University of Nottingham,<br>http://archiveshub.ac.uk/data/gb159-dr-dr4 [...] Jane Ronson 2014-06-30T14:48:38+00:00 2014-06-30T14:48:38+00:00 Archives Hub News - June 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;836dc578.1406 Dear all<br><br>**Twitter**<br><br>We're pleased to announce that we've reached over 10,000 followers on Twitter! You can follow us at: https://twitter.com/archiveshub.<br><br>**Latest descriptions**<br><br>Just a few of the descriptions added to the Hub during June:<br><br>* Records of the Marriott Family of Cotesbach - **New contributor: Cotesbach Educational Trust / Cotesbach Estate Archive**.<br>Deeds, legal and estate papers of Cotesbach and related estates, 15th - 20th centuries and the Marriott family papers, 17th - 20th centuries: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/data/gb3069-cotesbach [...] Jane Ronson 2014-05-30T12:33:37+00:00 2014-05-30T12:33:37+00:00 Archives Hub News - May 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;824129ea.1405 Dear all<br><br>**Hub monthly feature**<br><br>This month we look at dance-related collections on the Archives Hub - dancers, choreographers and teachers, schools<br>and companies, ballet, contemporary and other styles of dance.<br><br>Find out more at: http://archiveshub.ac.uk/blog/2014/05/a-spring-in-your-step<br><br>**Latest contributors**<br><br>Our latest contributors include:<br><br>* Cambridge University: Kettle's Yard Museum and Art Gallery - http://archiveshub.ac.uk/contributors/camkettlesyard.html<br><br>* Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance: Faculty of Music Archive - http://archiveshub.ac.uk/contributors/trinitylabanmusic.html [...] Jane Ronson 2014-04-30T12:39:40+00:00 2014-04-30T12:39:40+00:00 Archives Hub News - April 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARCHIVES-HUB-USERS;9978be78.1404 Dear all<br>**Hub monthly feature**<br>This month we're pleased to announce that we now have more than 250 UK institutions and organisations contributing to the Archives Hub! That amounts to:<br><br>* over 26,000 collection-level descriptions<br>* over 350,000 lower-level descriptions<br><br>Our contributors include universities, businesses, local authorities, museums, cathedrals, charities and other organisations. The wide range of archives covered by the Hub is demonstrated by the latest descriptions. [...]
